Text: Not being able to use magic sucks.
Violet kicks away a zombie on the ground.

As I said, I'm only a frail maiden. You, on the other
hand, seem perfectly capable even without magic.

Ever since I was a kid, I've been obsessed with
building a killer...
bod!
The head I chucked connects with a zombie.

So virile. Like a gorilla...no, a gorilla that throws
grown men.
Can't you come up with something a little cooler?

If there were a tournament for gorillâ€”um, humans
where magic wasn't allowed, you would surely win.
Thanks for trying harder.

Despite the high praise, I will eventually run out of
steam if I keep fighting like this.

As much as I don't mind this squash-fest, I can't see
it ever ending without magic.
That would be problematic.
I draw my sword and approach the crying girl.
Sorry 'bout this.

The world shatters as soon as I bring the blade down
on her.
Everything breaks into pieces...
and we find ourselves in the center of the Sanctuary.
It looks like a bunch of ruins.

The persistent hazy feeling that had persisted up to
this point vanishes as the slightly chilly air awakens
my senses.
The ceiling is high, and the area is lit by magic.
You okay?
Yes, thanks to you.
Is that...
Yes... The center.
So what do I need to break?
The magic core. It should be through that door.
I wonder if I can just cut the chains.
Why not?

Yep, not happening with this sword. It'll probably
break before those chains do.
Well, usually there'd be a key, wouldn't there?
Oh yeah, true.
So...maybe this?

For some reason there's a pedestal before the door
with a fancy sword stuck in it.

Yes. It says here that this sword will be able to cut
the chains.

Unfortunately, I know better. A sword in a
pedestal... Yeah, I know how this goes.
I already know what will happen.
Huh?
The sword won't come out...
What...?

I grip on the sword and try to pull it free, but as
expected it doesn't budge.
Looks like I was right...
The sword...is rejecting me...!
It can only be removed by the chosen one...!
What...?!

(I said it because it kinda fit the situation, but I
don't actually sense any sort of rejection at play
here.)

(Still, the "sword stuck in the stone that can only be
pulled free by the chosen hero" is a tired old trope
that everyone knows.)

Violet traces the ancient script on the pedestal with
a sense of urgency.

"Only a heroâ€™s direct descendant can draw the holy
sword." That is indeed what it says. I'm surprised
you could decipher the encrypted magic script so
quickly.
Heh. Believe me, I know all the classics.

You must be familiar with deciphering ancient text
and decoding magical script like this then. Is that
correct?
Yeah, something like that.
I nod proudly.

(A sacred sword in a stone and a sealed door that can
only be opened with said sword. Sure it's clichÃ©, but it's
one of my favorite gimmicks.)
(Hell yeah, this really feels like a fantasy world.)
All the same, this is a problem...
Is there no other way?
Not written here.
Gotcha.
I sit down next to Violet.
We sit in silence for a while.
